items.text: works this against the turn to wide long-on
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: reaches out to drive, but gets a thick bottom edge as this rolls to cover.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Liton Das, no run

items.text: turns this gently with the angle to square leg.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: reverse sweep but this is a good stop by Chatara, tumbling to his right at short third man.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: Ehtesham: "Who will open with Tamim in the WC 2019? Imrul? or Liton? or Soumyo? such a sweet homework for the selectors." -- Soumya can safely be ruled out for now, me thinks.
items.text: slices this cut, but straight to point.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: driven back towards the bowler for an easy single
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: too short, he rocks back and pulls to square leg.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.text: makes room and punches to point, frustrated with himself at not finding the gap.
items.postText: Mahneel Musa: "Really want Liton to convert this into a big hundred. Man deserves it after how hard he's been trolled for the Asia Cup stumping."
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.text: lunges forward and defends back towards the bowler.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.text: right to the pitch of the ball as he works this to midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.text: sharp turn back in from round the stumps, bunted towards point.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: did the ball slip off his hand? Sprays this too far wide outside off.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, 1 wide

items.text: drifts in to pitch on leg and spin back in further, keeper collects.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, 1 wide

items.text: mistimes this extra cover drive to the fielder.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: steps out to launch this over long-on but ends up getting a thick edge to beat short third man.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: brings out the reverse sweep, but hits this straight to short third man.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: eases this with the spin to long-on for an easy single.
items.postText: Jai: "I believe Liton will most likely open with Tamim, but Imrul will certainly be in the starting XI, or atleast in the squad. Unless Soumya scores consecutive hundreds, he'll probably get axed, just giving an exaggeration of his chances." -- You never know how Mr President thinks.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: gentle dab into the off side, straight to backward point.
items.shortText: Mavuta to Liton Das, no run

items.text: dropped by the keeper! Thick edge as he shapes to cut, tough chance but should've been taken.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: makes room, gets underneath the flight and lofts this cleanly inside-out over extra cover. Bit of a tease for long-off as the ball appeared to have plonked but it just managed to touch the skirting.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: steps out and works this gently with the spin to the leg side.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: Chayon: "At the Start of the series Hamilton maskadza mentioned them as a favorite. These two games surely indicates the difference between this two team. BD was not only the semifinalist of the last champions trophy but also the finalist of Asia Cup. BD is ahead of ZIM by far. "
items.text: makes a hint of room and cuts to point.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, no run

items.text: makes room and then cuts this into the gap between cover point and backward point. Excellent improvisation.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: steps out and slices this straight to cover point. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke. Raza got this to drift away a wee bit, hence ended up eliciting a slice and this is nicely taken at the edge of the ring. Muted celebration, Liton has missed a great opportunity at making a hundred here. Bangladesh lose one against the run of play.
items.postText: Time for change in controls at the deck. Liam is back again
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Liton Das, OUT

dismissal.text: Liton Das c Tiripano b Sikandar Raza 83 (77b 12x4 1x6) SR: 107.79

items.preText: Thanks Shashank. Well, Bangladesh's openers have well and truly set up this chase, with just 99 needed to win. Fazle Mahmud strides to the middle - can he better his debut effort? There's a change in the attack with the dismissal, and Jarvis is back.
items.text: he's full and straight to start with, and Kayes stands up to drive to cover
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run
